headline: London's Heathrow Airport reopens after fire causes outage
summary: London's Heathrow Airport has reopened late Friday after a nearby fire caused a power outage, disrupting global travel and canceling over 1,300 flights from the facility. Market Domination anchor Julie Hyman reports the latest. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Fire closes London's Heathrow Airport, disrupting global travel
summary: A fire has broken out near London's Heathrow Airport, causing a power outage and leaving 200,000 global travelers stranded and canceling over 1,300 flights from the facility. The Morning Brief's Brad Smith monitors how this headline is impacting airline stocks. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Heathrow Airport shuts down after fire, traffic snarled
summary: Heathrow Airport, one of the world's busiest, is closed today after a fire at an electrical substation nearby caused a massive power outage. The closure has sparked travel chaos across the globe, with over 1,300 flights already canceled. Following the news, travel and leisure stocks in the US and UK, including Delta (DAL) and British Airways parent International Airlines Group, are under pressure today. Tune in to The Morning Brief beginning at 9am ET with Brad Smith and Myles Udland for the latest developments.

headline: United Airlines expects to fly to Heathrow for Saturday arrival
summary: United Airlines expects its flights to be able to leave the United States later on Friday and land at London's Heathrow Airport on Saturday morning local time, a company spokesperson said. ...
